converse.line: Welcome to Bongani's Pawnshop! What'll it be?

choice.line: I'd like to buy some ramen. Do you have any in stock?
Haven't you been to a pawnshop before, girl? You trade things of equal value here. This ain't no convenience store.
My bad.
You have any board games I could trade for?
Ah, you're one of those board game types. Let me take a look...
I've got two. One called "Tokaido," another called "Roll for it." Each has a net worth of about #60.00. D'ya want either?
(Expensive!) No, thank you. I don't have enough.
Well, come back if you have some more.
Any video games?
I have only one. There're popular items these days. It's called "Gitaroo Man." Used, worth about #35.00. How's about a purchase?
I don't have enough money for that one... Maybe I'll buy it later.
It's a rare game. I can't guarantee I can hold it for you.

converse.line: Be safe out there, girl.
Welcome to Bongani's Pawnshop! What'll it be?
Do you have any lockets?
A locket, eh? Looking for one in particular? I've got like seven different ones.
It's made of silver and gold, if that helps.
Oooh! Fancy. This must be it. Its value is... #175.00. Got something equal to that value?

choice.line: Of course I do.
Show me.
Sorry, I lied.
Cheeky girl.
No, I don't.
Then what were you thinking when you wanted to pay for the locket?

converse.line: The truth is, that locket you have was stolen from this old lady. Her story is actually really sad...

That's some heavy stuff, girl. I understand completely. However, I do have a business to run and that piece is quite expensive. If you can give me something of slightly less value, say around #125.00, I'll consider it for Nakamura's sake. How does that sound?
You are very generous, but how am I supposed to find an item like that? I'm not exactly rich.
You ask all the tough questions. Try asking a politician. They are usually very rich, retired people who do politics on the side.
I'll see what I can do. Thanks again!
My pleasure, girl.

choice.line: How's business?
Could be better. I've been barely keeping this place running. Not to mention preventing all the robberies in this area. Good thing I'm a big, burly man that no one wants to mess with. Har, har, har!
You sure are. "Har, har, har."
Don't be mocking me, girl.
Where did you say I could find someone with a lot of money?
Try Mourilyan. A lot of rich people settle there.
(Excluding, of course, my family.) Thanks!

converse.line: How's this in exchange for the locket?
Let's take a look...
Oooh. That's a real fine piece there. I'd say it'd just about cover the cost of the locket.
Sweet! It's a deal then.
It's been a pleasure doing business with you, girl. Be sure to tell your friends to come on down to Bongani's Pawnshop.
I sure will.
You returned that locket, yet? Tell me how it goes.
How did it go?
It really brightened her day. Thank you for the huge discount!
My pleasure, girl. I have a soft spot for old ladies.
Welcome, Emere! What can I do for ya?

choice.line: Got anything interesting in stock?
Just this morning some guy traded in a copy of Final Fantasy 6. I hear it's a great game.
I'll have to play it some time.
Have you heard anything from Nakamura?
Yeah! She stopped by here to chat with me. She'd never been here before, even though this store is so close by. I think I've made a new customer.
Glad to hear it!
